Operation 'getAirTraffic' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, unclear_purpose, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_context, poor_ai_interpretability. The current summary is generic and doesn't convey the specific purpose of identifying busiest periods. The description is completely empty, providing no guidance for AI agents. The operation's domain-specific purpose (analyzing busiest traveling periods) is not evident from the summary alone. Improved version clarifies that this is an analytics operation focused on identifying peak travel periods, explains the expected inputs (filtering parameters), outputs (traffic statistics and peak period data), and provides context about use cases. This helps AI agents understand when to invoke this operation and what to expect.

data.current_summary: Returns a list of air traffic reports.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve busiest travel periods by air traffic
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves air traffic analytics data identifying the busiest traveling periods. This operation analyzes historical flight traffic patterns to determine peak travel times. Accepts parameters to filter results by route, date range, or other traffic criteria. Returns air traffic statistics including peak period information, traveler volume metrics, and traffic intensity data. Useful for identifying optimal booking windows and understanding travel demand patterns.
